      Creates a new MatOfPoint3f with this 3d rotation. The opencv rvec Mat is a vector with three elements representing the axis scaled by the angle in the EDN coordinate system. (angle = norm, and axis = rvec / norm)
      Parameters:
      rotation - The rotation to convert into a MatOfPoint3f

    • reorderCircular

      public static <T> java.util.List<T> reorderCircular​(java.util.List<T> elements, boolean backwards, int shiftStart)
      Reorders the list, optionally indexing backwards and wrapping around to the last element after the first, and shifting all indices in the direction of indexing.

      e.g.

      ({1,2,3}, false, 1) == {2,3,1}

      ({1,2,3}, true, 0) == {1,3,2}

      ({1,2,3}, true, 1) == {3,2,1}

      Type Parameters:
      T - Element type
      Parameters:
      elements -
      backwards - If indexing should happen in reverse (0, size-1, size-2, ...)
      shiftStart - How much the inital index should be shifted (instead of starting at index 0, start at shiftStart, negated if backwards)
      Returns:
      Reordered list

    • projectPoints

      public static java.util.List<org.photonvision.targeting.TargetCorner> projectPoints​(edu.wpi.first.math.Matrix<edu.wpi.first.math.numbers.N3,​edu.wpi.first.math.numbers.N3> cameraMatrix, edu.wpi.first.math.Matrix<edu.wpi.first.math.numbers.N5,​edu.wpi.first.math.numbers.N1> distCoeffs, edu.wpi.first.math.geometry.Pose3d camPose, java.util.List<edu.wpi.first.math.geometry.Translation3d> objectTranslations)
      Project object points from the 3d world into the 2d camera image. The camera properties(intrinsics, distortion) determine the results of this projection.
      Parameters:
      cameraMatrix - the camera intrinsics matrix in standard opencv form
      distCoeffs - the camera distortion matrix in standard opencv form
      camPose - The current camera pose in the 3d world
      objectTranslations - The 3d points to be projected
      Returns:
      The 2d points in pixels which correspond to the image of the 3d points on the camera

    • undistortPoints

      public static java.util.List<org.photonvision.targeting.TargetCorner> undistortPoints​(edu.wpi.first.math.Matrix<edu.wpi.first.math.numbers.N3,​edu.wpi.first.math.numbers.N3> cameraMatrix, edu.wpi.first.math.Matrix<edu.wpi.first.math.numbers.N5,​edu.wpi.first.math.numbers.N1> distCoeffs, java.util.List<org.photonvision.targeting.TargetCorner> corners)
      Undistort 2d image points using a given camera's intrinsics and distortion.

      2d image points from projectPoints(CameraProperties, Pose3d, List) projectPoints} will naturally be distorted, so this operation is important if the image points need to be directly used (e.g. 2d yaw/pitch).

      Parameters:
      cameraMatrix - the camera intrinsics matrix in standard opencv form
      distCoeffs - the camera distortion matrix in standard opencv form
      corners - The distorted image points
      Returns:
      The undistorted image points

    • getBoundingRect

      public static org.opencv.core.Rect getBoundingRect​(java.util.List<org.photonvision.targeting.TargetCorner> corners)
      Gets the (upright) rectangle which bounds this contour.

      Note that rectangle size and position are stored with ints and do not have sub-pixel accuracy.

      Parameters:
      corners - The corners/points to be bounded
      Returns:
      Rectangle bounding the given corners

    • getMinAreaRect

      public static org.opencv.core.RotatedRect getMinAreaRect​(java.util.List<org.photonvision.targeting.TargetCorner> corners)
      Gets the rotated rectangle with minimum area which bounds this contour.

      Note that rectangle size and position are stored with doubles and have sub-pixel accuracy.

      Parameters:
      corners - The corners/points to be bounded
      Returns:
      Rotated rectangle bounding the given corners

    • getContourAreaPx

      public static double getContourAreaPx​(java.util.List<org.photonvision.targeting.TargetCorner> corners)
      Get the area in pixels of this target's contour. It's important to note that this may be different from the area of the bounding rectangle around the contour.
      Parameters:
      corners - The corners defining this contour
      Returns:
      Area in pixels (units of corner x/y)

    • solvePNP_SQUARE

      public static PNPResults solvePNP_SQUARE​(edu.wpi.first.math.Matrix<edu.wpi.first.math.numbers.N3,​edu.wpi.first.math.numbers.N3> cameraMatrix, edu.wpi.first.math.Matrix<edu.wpi.first.math.numbers.N5,​edu.wpi.first.math.numbers.N1> distCoeffs, java.util.List<edu.wpi.first.math.geometry.Translation3d> modelTrls, java.util.List<org.photonvision.targeting.TargetCorner> imageCorners)
      Finds the transformation(s) that map the camera's pose to the target pose. The camera's pose relative to the target is determined by the supplied 3d points of the target's model and their associated 2d points imaged by the camera.

      For planar targets, there may be an alternate solution which is plausible given the 2d image points. This has an associated "ambiguity" which describes the ratio of reprojection error between the "best" and "alternate" solution.

      This method is intended for use with individual AprilTags, and will not work unless 4 points are provided.

      Parameters:
      cameraMatrix - the camera intrinsics matrix in standard opencv form
      distCoeffs - the camera distortion matrix in standard opencv form
      modelTrls - The translations of the object corners. These should have the object pose as their origin. These must come in a specific, pose-relative order (in NWU):
      • Point 0: [0, -squareLength / 2, squareLength / 2]
      • Point 1: [0, squareLength / 2, squareLength / 2]
      • Point 2: [0, squareLength / 2, -squareLength / 2]
      • Point 3: [0, -squareLength / 2, -squareLength / 2]
      imageCorners - The projection of these 3d object points into the 2d camera image. The order should match the given object point translations.
      Returns:
      The resulting transformation that maps the camera pose to the target pose and the ambiguity if an alternate solution is available.

    • solvePNP_SQPNP

      public static PNPResults solvePNP_SQPNP​(edu.wpi.first.math.Matrix<edu.wpi.first.math.numbers.N3,​edu.wpi.first.math.numbers.N3> cameraMatrix, edu.wpi.first.math.Matrix<edu.wpi.first.math.numbers.N5,​edu.wpi.first.math.numbers.N1> distCoeffs, java.util.List<edu.wpi.first.math.geometry.Translation3d> objectTrls, java.util.List<org.photonvision.targeting.TargetCorner> imageCorners)
      Finds the transformation that maps the camera's pose to the target pose. The camera's pose relative to the target is determined by the supplied 3d points of the target's model and their associated 2d points imaged by the camera.

      This method is intended for use with multiple targets and has no alternate solutions. There must be at least 3 points.

      Parameters:
      cameraMatrix - the camera intrinsics matrix in standard opencv form
      distCoeffs - the camera distortion matrix in standard opencv form
      objectTrls - The translations of the object corners, relative to the field.
      imageCorners - The projection of these 3d object points into the 2d camera image. The order should match the given object point translations.
      Returns:
      The resulting transformation that maps the camera pose to the target pose. If the 3d model points are supplied relative to the origin, this transformation brings the camera to the origin.
